intro: Elatostema filipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed elatostema, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant typically has slender, upright stems and small, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, and it produces small, dry fruits. Elatostema filipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
